Moreover, it is easy to check that the cross-variation of Wtℛsubscriptsuperscript𝑊ℛ𝑡W^{\mathcal{R}}_{t}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the same as the one of Wtsubscript𝑊𝑡W_{t}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then, we can conclude the proof by Levy’s characterization of Brownian motion (W0ℛ=0subscriptsuperscript𝑊ℛ00W^{\mathcal{R}}_{0}=0italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0).

Appendix C Proof of Theorem 3

First, by combining the definition of ψtℛsubscriptsuperscript𝜓ℛ𝑡\psi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t}italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the fact that dYt=𝔼P⁢[H⁢(Yt,X,t)|ℛt]+dWtℛsubscript𝑌𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡𝑋𝑡subscriptℛ𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑊ℛ𝑡\differential Y_{t}=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[H(Y_{t},X,t)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}]+% \differential W^{\mathcal{R}}_{t}start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_t ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] + start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT we obtain

(ψtℛ)−1=exp⁡(−∫0t𝔼P⁢[H⁢(Ys,X,s)|ℛs]⁢dWsℛ−12⁢∫0t‖𝔼P⁢[H⁢(Ys,X,s)|ℛs]‖2⁢ds).superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝜓ℛ𝑡1superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscriptℛ𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝑊ℛ𝑠12superscriptsubscript0𝑡superscriptnormsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscriptℛ𝑠2𝑠(\psi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t})^{-1}=\exp(-\int_{0}^{t}\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[H(Y_{s% },X,s)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{s}]\differential W^{\mathcal{R}}_{s}-\frac{1}{2}\int_{% 0}^{t}\norm{\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[H(Y_{s},X,s)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{s}]}^{2}% \differential s).( italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_exp ( start_ARG - ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s end_ARG ) . (23)

Notice that by 6 (which is actually the usual Novikov’s condition), the local martingale (ψtℛ)−1superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝜓ℛ𝑡1(\psi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t})^{-1}( italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a real-valued martingale starting from (ψ0ℛ)−1=1superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝜓ℛ011(\psi^{\mathcal{R}}_{0})^{-1}=1( italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 1. Then, we can apply Girsanov theorem and conclude that dQℛ=ψTℛ⁢dPsuperscriptQℛsubscriptsuperscript𝜓ℛ𝑇P\differential{\mathrm{Q}^{\mathcal{R}}}=\psi^{\mathcal{R}}_{T}\differential% \mathrm{P}start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P is a probability measure under which the process {W~0≤t≤T,ℛ0≤t≤T}subscript~𝑊0𝑡𝑇subscriptℛ0𝑡𝑇\{\tilde{W}_{0\leq t\leq T},\mathcal{R}_{0\leq t\leq T}\}{ over~ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_t ≤ italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_t ≤ italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, with

Wt~=Wtℛ+∫0t𝔼P⁢[H⁢(Yt,X,s)|ℛt]⁢ds,~subscript𝑊𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑊ℛ𝑡superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡𝑋𝑠subscriptℛ𝑡𝑠\tilde{W_{t}}=W^{\mathcal{R}}_{t}+\int_{0}^{t}\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[H(Y_{t},% X,s)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}]\differential s,over~ start_ARG italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s ,

is a Brownian motion on the space (Ω,ℛT,Qℛ)Ωsubscriptℛ𝑇superscriptQℛ(\Omega,\mathcal{R}_{T},{\mathrm{Q}^{\mathcal{R}}})( roman_Ω , caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ).

Appendix D Proof of Theorem 4

First, let us give a precise meaning to being a weak solution of Equation 6. We say that πtℛsubscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t}italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT solves (6) in a weak sense in, for any for any ϕ:𝒮→ℝ:italic-ϕ→𝒮ℝ\phi:\mathcal{S}\to\mathbb{R}italic_ϕ : caligraphic_S → blackboard_R bounded and measurable, it holds

⟨πtℛ,ϕ⟩subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕ\displaystyle\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi\rangle⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩ =⟨π0ℛ,ϕ⟩absentsubscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ0italic-ϕ\displaystyle=\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{0},\phi\rangle= ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩ (24)
+∫0t(⟨πsℛ,H⁢(Ys,⋅,s)⁢ϕ⟩−⟨πsℛ,ϕ⟩⁢⟨πsℛ,H⁢(Ys,⋅,s)⟩)⁢(dYs−⟨πsℛ,H⁢(Ys,⋅,s)⟩⁢ds).superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑠𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠⋅𝑠italic-ϕsubscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑠italic-ϕsubscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑠𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠⋅𝑠subscript𝑌𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑠𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠⋅𝑠𝑠\displaystyle\quad+\int_{0}^{t}\left(\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{s},H(Y_{s},% \cdot,s)\phi\rangle-\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{s},\phi\rangle\langle\pi^{% \mathcal{R}}_{s},H(Y_{s},\cdot,s)\rangle\right)\left(\differential Y_{s}-% \langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{s},H(Y_{s},\cdot,s)\rangle\differential s\right).+ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_s ) italic_ϕ ⟩ - ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩ ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_s ) ⟩ ) ( start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_s ) ⟩ start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s ) .

Let us recall that, on (Ω,ℱ,P)ΩℱP(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\mathrm{P})( roman_Ω , caligraphic_F , roman_P ), the process Ytsubscript𝑌𝑡Y_{t}italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has the SDE representation (1), where {W0≤t≤T,ℱ0≤t≤TY,X}subscript𝑊0𝑡𝑇subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋0𝑡𝑇\{W_{0\leq t\leq T},\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}_{0\leq t\leq T}\}{ italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_t ≤ italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_t ≤ italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } is a Brownian motion. Moreover, by Theorem 3 with ℛt=ℱtY,Xsubscriptℛ𝑡subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋𝑡\mathcal{R}_{t}=\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}_{t}caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, it holds that {(Y−Y0)0≤t≤T,ℱ0≤t≤TY,X}subscript𝑌subscript𝑌00𝑡𝑇subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋0𝑡𝑇\{(Y-Y_{0})_{0\leq t\leq T},\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}_{0\leq t\leq T}\}{ ( italic_Y - italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_t ≤ italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_t ≤ italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } is a Brownian motion on the space (Ω,ℱ,QℱY,X)ΩℱsuperscriptQsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋(\Omega,\mathcal{F},{\mathrm{Q}}^{\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}})( roman_Ω , caligraphic_F , roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), where dQℱY,X=(ψTℱY,X)−1⁢dPsuperscriptQsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝜓superscriptℱ𝑌𝑋𝑇1P\differential{\mathrm{Q}}^{\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}}=(\psi^{\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}}_{T})^{% -1}\differential\mathrm{P}start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P and

ψtℱY,X=exp⁡(∫0tH⁢(Ys,X,s)⁢dYs−12⁢∫0t‖H⁢(Ys,X,s)‖2⁢ds).subscriptsuperscript𝜓superscriptℱ𝑌𝑋𝑡superscriptsubscript0𝑡𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscript𝑌𝑠12superscriptsubscript0𝑡superscriptnorm𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠2𝑠\psi^{\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}}_{t}=\exp(\int_{0}^{t}H(Y_{s},X,s)\differential Y_{s}-% \frac{1}{2}\int_{0}^{t}\norm{H(Y_{s},X,s)}^{2}\differential s).italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_exp ( start_ARG ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_ARG italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s end_ARG ) . (25)

For notation simplicity, in this subsection ψtℱY,Xsuperscriptsubscript𝜓𝑡superscriptℱ𝑌𝑋\psi_{t}^{\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}}italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and QℱY,XsuperscriptQsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋{\mathrm{Q}}^{\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}}roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are simply indicated as πtsubscript𝜋𝑡\pi_{t}italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ψtsubscript𝜓𝑡\psi_{t}italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and QQ{\mathrm{Q}}roman_Q respectively.

Since we aim at showing that (24) holds, let us fix ϕitalic-ϕ\phiitalic_ϕ and let us start from 𝔼P⁢[ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt]=⟨πtℛ,ϕ⟩subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalitalic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕ\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\phi(X)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}]=\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_% {t},\phi\rangleblackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩. Bayes Theorem provides us with the following

⟨πtℛ,ϕ⟩=𝔼P⁢[ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt]=𝔼Q⁢[dPdQ⁢ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt]𝔼Q⁢[dPdQ|ℛt]=𝔼Q⁢[ψT⁢ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt]𝔼Q⁢[ψT|ℛt]=def⟨π^tℛ,ϕ⟩⟨π^tℛ,1⟩.subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalitalic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalPQitalic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalPQsubscriptℛ𝑡subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝜓𝑇italic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝜓𝑇subscriptℛ𝑡superscriptdefsubscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕsubscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡1\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi\rangle=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\phi(X)\,|\,% Starting from the numerator ⟨π^tℛ,ϕ⟩subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕ\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi\rangle⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩, we involve the tower property of conditional expectation and the fact that ψtsubscript𝜓𝑡\psi_{t}italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is ℱtY,Xsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋𝑡\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}_{t}caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT measurable to write

⟨π^tℛ,ϕ⟩subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕ\displaystyle\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi\rangle⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩ =𝔼Q⁢[ψT⁢ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt]=𝔼Q⁢[𝔼Q⁢[ψT⁢ϕ⁢(X)|ℱtY,X]|ℛt]absentsubscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝜓𝑇italic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝜓𝑇italic-ϕ𝑋subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋𝑡subscriptℛ𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}[\psi_{T}\phi(X)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}]=% \mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\psi_{T}\phi(X)% \,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}_{t}\right]\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}\right]= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]
=𝔼Q⁢[𝔼Q⁢[ψT|ℱtY,X]⁢ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt]=𝔼Q⁢[ψt⁢ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt].absentsubscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝜓𝑇subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋𝑡italic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝜓𝑡italic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[% \psi_{T}\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}_{t}\right]\phi(X)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}\right]=% \mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\psi_{t}\phi(X)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}\right].= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] . (27)

Recalling the definition of ψtsubscript𝜓𝑡\psi_{t}italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (see Equation 25), we have

dψt=ψt⁢H⁢(Yt,X,t)⁢dYt,subscript𝜓𝑡subscript𝜓𝑡𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡𝑋𝑡subscript𝑌𝑡\displaystyle\differential\psi_{t}=\psi_{t}H(Y_{t},X,t)\differential Y_{t},start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_t ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (28)

from which it follows

ψt=1+∫0tψs⁢H⁢(Ys,X,s)⁢dYs.subscript𝜓𝑡1superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝜓𝑠𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscript𝑌𝑠\psi_{t}=1+\int_{0}^{t}\psi_{s}H(Y_{s},X,s)\differential Y_{s}.italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (29)

We continue processing Equation 27, using Equation 29, as

𝔼Q⁢[ψt⁢ϕ⁢(X)|ℛs]subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝜓𝑡italic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑠\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\psi_{t}\phi(X)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{s% }\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] =𝔼Q⁢[(1+∫0tψs⁢H⁢(Ys,X,s)⁢dYs)⁢ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt]absentsubscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditional1superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝜓𝑠𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscript𝑌𝑠italic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\left(1+\int_{0}^{t}\psi_{s}H(Y_{% s},X,s)\differential Y_{s}\right)\phi(X)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}\right]= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ( 1 + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]
=𝔼Q⁢[ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt]+𝔼Q⁢[∫0tψs⁢H⁢(Ys,X,s)⁢ϕ⁢(X)⁢dYs|ℛt]absentsubscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalitalic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsuperscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝜓𝑠𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠italic-ϕ𝑋subscript𝑌𝑠subscriptℛ𝑡\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\phi(X)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}\right% ]+\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\int_{0}^{t}\psi_{s}H(Y_{s},X,s)\phi(X)% \differential Y_{s}\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}\right]= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] + blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]
=𝔼Q⁢[ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt]+∫0t𝔼Q⁢[ψs⁢H⁢(Ys,X,s)⁢ϕ⁢(X)|ℛs]⁢dYs,absentsubscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalitalic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝜓𝑠𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠italic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑠subscript𝑌𝑠\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\phi(X)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}\right% ]+\int_{0}^{t}\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\psi_{s}H(Y_{s},X,s)\phi(X)\,|\,% \mathcal{R}_{s}\right]\differential Y_{s},= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

where to obtain the last equality we used Lemma 5.4 in Xiong (2008). We also recall that, under QQ{\mathrm{Q}}roman_Q, the process (Yt−Y0)subscript𝑌𝑡subscript𝑌0(Y_{t}-Y_{0})( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is independent of X𝑋Xitalic_X. Thus, since ℛt=σ⁢(ℛ0∪σ⁢(Y0≤s≤t−Y0))subscriptℛ𝑡𝜎subscriptℛ0𝜎subscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡subscript𝑌0\mathcal{R}_{t}=\sigma(\mathcal{R}_{0}\cup\sigma(Y_{0\leq s\leq t}-Y_{0}))caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_σ ( caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∪ italic_σ ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) and dPdQ|ℱ0Y,X=1evaluated-atPQsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋01\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}}{\differential{\mathrm{Q}}}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y% ,X}_{0}}=1divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q end_ARG | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1, we obtain 𝔼Q⁢[ϕ⁢(X)|ℛt]=𝔼P⁢[ϕ⁢(X)|ℛ0]subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalitalic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalitalic-ϕ𝑋subscriptℛ0\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\phi(X)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}\right]=\mathbb{E}_{% \mathrm{P}}[\phi(X)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{0}]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ϕ ( italic_X ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Concluding and rearranging:

⟨π^tℛ,ϕ⟩=⟨π^0ℛ,ϕ⟩+∫0t⟨π^sℛ,ϕ⁢H⁢(Ys,⋅,s)⟩⁢dYs.subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕsubscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ0italic-ϕsuperscriptsubscript0𝑡subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑠italic-ϕ𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠⋅𝑠subscript𝑌𝑠\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi\rangle=\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_% {0},\phi\rangle+\int_{0}^{t}\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{s},\phi H(Y_{s},% \cdot,s)\rangle\differential Y_{s}.⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩ = ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩ + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_s ) ⟩ start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Obviously by the same arguments ⟨π^tℛ,1⟩=𝔼Q⁢[dPdQ|ℛt]=𝔼Q⁢[ψt|ℛt]subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡1subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalPQsubscriptℛ𝑡subscript𝔼Qdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝜓𝑡subscriptℛ𝑡\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},1\rangle=\mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}[\frac{% \differential\mathrm{P}}{\differential{\mathrm{Q}}}\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}]=% \mathbb{E}_{{\mathrm{Q}}}\left[\psi_{t}\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{t}\right]⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 1 ⟩ = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q end_ARG | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], and

⟨π^tℛ,1⟩=1+∫0t⟨π^sℛ,H⁢(Ys,⋅,s)⟩⁢dYs.subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡11superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑠𝐻subscript𝑌𝑠⋅𝑠subscript𝑌𝑠\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},1\rangle=1+\int_{0}^{t}\langle\hat{\pi}^{% \mathcal{R}}_{s},H(Y_{s},\cdot,s)\rangle\differential Y_{s}.⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 1 ⟩ = 1 + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_s ) ⟩ start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (30)

From now on, for simplicity we assume that all the processes involved in our computations are 1111-dimensional. The extension to the multidimensional case is trivial. First, let us notice that, by (30) and Itô’s lemma, it holds

d(⟨π^tℛ,1⟩−1)=−⟨π^tℛ,H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩⟨π^tℛ,1⟩2⁢dYs+⟨π^tℛ,H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩2⟨π^tℛ,1⟩3⁢dt.superscriptsubscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡11subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡superscriptsubscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡12subscript𝑌𝑠superscriptsubscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡2superscriptsubscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡13𝑡\differential(\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},1\rangle^{-1})=-\frac{\langle% \hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},H(Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle}{\langle\hat{\pi}^{% \mathcal{R}}_{t},1\rangle^{2}}\differential Y_{s}+\frac{\langle\hat{\pi}^{% \mathcal{R}}_{t},H(Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle^{2}}{\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{% t},1\rangle^{3}}\differential t.roman_d ( start_ARG ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 1 ⟩ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) = - divide start_ARG ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ end_ARG start_ARG ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 1 ⟩ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + divide start_ARG ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 1 ⟩ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_t . (31)

+⟨π^tℛ,ϕ⁢H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩⟨π^tℛ,1⟩⁢dYt−⟨π^tℛ,ϕ⁢H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩⁢⟨π^tℛ,H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩⟨π^tℛ,1⟩2⁢dt.subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕ𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡1subscript𝑌𝑡subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕ𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡subscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡superscriptsubscriptsuperscript^𝜋ℛ𝑡12𝑡\displaystyle\quad+\frac{\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi H(Y_{t},\cdot% ,t)\rangle}{\langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},1\rangle}\differential Y_{t}-% \langle\hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi H(Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle\frac{\langle% \hat{\pi}^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},H(Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle}{\langle\hat{\pi}^{% \mathcal{R}}_{t},1\rangle^{2}}\differential t.+ divide start_ARG ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ end_ARG start_ARG ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 1 ⟩ end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ divide start_ARG ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ end_ARG start_ARG ⟨ over^ start_ARG italic_π end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 1 ⟩ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_t .

Recalling (26) and rearranging the terms lead us to

d⟨πtℛ,ψ⟩subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡𝜓\displaystyle\differential\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\psi\ranglestart_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ψ ⟩ =−⟨πtℛ,ϕ⟩⁢⟨πtℛ,H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩⁢dYt+⟨πtℛ,ϕ⟩⁢⟨πtℛ,H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩2⁢dtabsentsubscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕsubscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡subscript𝑌𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕsuperscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡2𝑡\displaystyle=-\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi\rangle\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}% }_{t},H(Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle\differential Y_{t}+\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},% \phi\rangle\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},H(Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle^{2}\differential t= - ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩ ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩ ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_t
+⟨πtℛ,ϕ⁢H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩⁢dYt−⟨πtℛ,ϕ⁢H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩⁢⟨πtℛ,H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩⁢dtsubscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕ𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡subscript𝑌𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕ𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡𝑡\displaystyle\quad+\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi H(Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle% \differential Y_{t}-\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi H(Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle% \langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},H(Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle\differential t+ ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_t
=(⟨πtℛ,ϕ⁢H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩−⟨πtℛ,ϕ⟩⁢⟨πtℛ,H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩)⁢(dYt−⟨πtℛ,H⁢(Yt,⋅,t)⟩⁢dt).absentsubscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕ𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡italic-ϕsubscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡subscript𝑌𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜋ℛ𝑡𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡⋅𝑡𝑡\displaystyle=\left(\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi H(Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle-% \langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},\phi\rangle\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},H(Y_{t},% \cdot,t)\rangle\right)\left(\differential Y_{t}-\langle\pi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t},H% (Y_{t},\cdot,t)\rangle\differential t\right).= ( ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ - ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ⟩ ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ ) ( start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ⋅ , italic_t ) ⟩ start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_t ) .

Appendix E Proof of Theorem 5

The proof of this Theorem involves two separate parts. First, we should show the second equality in Equation 7, i.e. ∫log⁡dP#⁢Y0≤s≤t,ϕdP#⁢Y0≤s≤t⁢dP#⁢ϕ⁢dP#⁢Y0≤s≤t,ϕ=𝔼P⁢[log⁡dP|ℛtdP|ℱtY⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ)]subscriptP#subscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡italic-ϕsubscriptP#subscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡subscriptP#italic-ϕsubscriptP#subscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡italic-ϕsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]evaluated-atPsubscriptℛ𝑡evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕ\int\log\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#Y_{0\leq s\leq t},\phi}}{% \differential\mathrm{P}_{\#Y_{0\leq s\leq t}}\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#\phi}}% \differential\mathrm{P}_{\#Y_{0\leq s\leq t},\phi}=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}% \left[\log\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}}}{\differential% \mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi% )}}\right]∫ roman_log divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_ϕ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ]. Then, we should prove that the r.h.s of Equation 7 is equal to Equation 8.

E.1 Part 1

We overload in this Section the notation adopted in the rest of the paper for sake of simplicity in exposition. A random variable X𝑋Xitalic_X on a probability space (Ω,ℱ,P)ΩℱP(\Omega,\mathcal{F},\mathrm{P})( roman_Ω , caligraphic_F , roman_P ) is defined as a measurable mapping X:Ω→Ψ:𝑋→ΩΨX:\Omega\rightarrow\Psiitalic_X : roman_Ω → roman_Ψ, where the measure space (Ψ,𝒢)Ψ𝒢(\Psi,\mathcal{G})( roman_Ψ , caligraphic_G ) satisfies the usual assumptions. To be precise, X𝑋Xitalic_X is measurable w.r.t. ℱℱ\mathcal{F}caligraphic_F if ∀E∈𝒢,X−1⁢(E)∈ℱformulae-sequencefor-all𝐸𝒢superscript𝑋1𝐸ℱ\forall E\in\mathcal{G},X^{-1}(E)\in\mathcal{F}∀ italic_E ∈ caligraphic_G , italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_E ) ∈ caligraphic_F, where X−1⁢(E)={ω∈Ω:X⁢(ω)∈E}superscript𝑋1𝐸conditional-set𝜔Ω𝑋𝜔𝐸X^{-1}(E)=\{\omega\in\Omega:X(\omega)\in E\}italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_E ) = { italic_ω ∈ roman_Ω : italic_X ( italic_ω ) ∈ italic_E }. Equivalently, ∀E∈𝒢,∃S∈ℱ:X⁢(S)=E:formulae-sequencefor-all𝐸𝒢𝑆ℱ𝑋𝑆𝐸\forall E\in\mathcal{G},\exists S\in\mathcal{F}:X(S)=E∀ italic_E ∈ caligraphic_G , ∃ italic_S ∈ caligraphic_F : italic_X ( italic_S ) = italic_E. Of all the possible sigma-algebras which allow measurability, the sigma algebra induced by the random variable, σ⁢(X)𝜎𝑋\sigma(X)italic_σ ( italic_X ), is the smallest one. It can be shown that σ⁢(X)=X−1⁢(𝒢)={A=X−1⁢(B)|B∈𝒢}𝜎𝑋superscript𝑋1𝒢conditional-set𝐴superscript𝑋1𝐵𝐵𝒢\sigma(X)=X^{-1}(\mathcal{G})=\{A=X^{-1}(B)|B\in\mathcal{G}\}italic_σ ( italic_X ) = italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( caligraphic_G ) = { italic_A = italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_B ) | italic_B ∈ caligraphic_G }. We also denote by P#⁢X:𝒢→[0,1]:subscriptP#𝑋→𝒢01\mathrm{P}_{\#}X\colon\mathcal{G}\to[0,1]roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X : caligraphic_G → [ 0 , 1 ] the push-forward measure associated to X𝑋Xitalic_X (i.e. the law), which is defined by the relation P#⁢X⁢(E)=P⁢(X−1⁢(E))subscriptP#𝑋𝐸Psuperscript𝑋1𝐸\mathrm{P}_{\#X}(E)=\mathrm{P}(X^{-1}(E))roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_E ) = roman_P ( italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_E ) ) for any E∈𝒢𝐸𝒢E\in\mathcal{G}italic_E ∈ caligraphic_G. Moreover, for any 𝒢𝒢\mathcal{G}caligraphic_G-measurable ϕitalic-ϕ\phiitalic_ϕ, the following integration rule holds

∫Ψφ⁢(x)⁢dP#⁢X⁢(x)=∫Ωφ⁢(X⁢(ω))⁢dP⁢(ω).subscriptΨ𝜑𝑥subscriptP#𝑋𝑥subscriptΩ𝜑𝑋𝜔P𝜔\int_{\Psi}\varphi(x)\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#X}(x)=\int_{\Omega}\varphi(X(% \omega))\differential\mathrm{P}(\omega).∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_φ ( italic_x ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ω end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_φ ( italic_X ( italic_ω ) ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P ( italic_ω ) . (32)

Let us focus on (Ω,σ⁢(X),P)Ω𝜎𝑋P(\Omega,\sigma(X),\mathrm{P})( roman_Ω , italic_σ ( italic_X ) , roman_P ) and let us consider a new measure QQ\mathrm{Q}roman_Q absolutely continuous w.r.t. PP\mathrm{P}roman_P. Radon-Nikodym theorem guarantees existence of a σ⁢(X)𝜎𝑋\sigma(X)italic_σ ( italic_X )-measurable function Z:Ω→[0,+∞):𝑍→Ω0Z\colon\Omega\to[0,+\infty)italic_Z : roman_Ω → [ 0 , + ∞ ) (the “derivative” dQdP=ZQP𝑍\frac{\differential\mathrm{Q}}{\differential\mathrm{P}}=Zdivide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P end_ARG = italic_Z) such that Q⁢(A)=∫AZ⁢dPQ𝐴subscript𝐴𝑍P\mathrm{Q}(A)=\int_{A}Z\differential\mathrm{P}roman_Q ( italic_A ) = ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Z start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P, for all A∈σ⁢(X)𝐴𝜎𝑋A\in\sigma(X)italic_A ∈ italic_σ ( italic_X ). Moreover, by Doob’s measurability criterion (see e.g. Lemma 1.13 in Kallenberg (2002)), there exists a 𝒢𝒢\mathcal{G}caligraphic_G-measurable map f:Ψ→[0,+∞):𝑓→Ψ0f\colon\Psi\to[0,+\infty)italic_f : roman_Ψ → [ 0 , + ∞ ) such that Z=f⁢(X)𝑍𝑓𝑋Z=f(X)italic_Z = italic_f ( italic_X ). Then, for any E∈𝒢𝐸𝒢E\in\mathcal{G}italic_E ∈ caligraphic_G,

Q#⁢X⁢(E)subscriptQ#𝑋𝐸\displaystyle\mathrm{Q}_{\#X}(E)roman_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_E ) =Q⁢(X−1⁢(E))=∫X−1⁢(E)f⁢(X)⁢dP⁢(ω)=∫Ω𝟏X−1⁢(E)⁢(ω)⁢f⁢(X⁢(ω))⁢dP⁢(ω)absentQsuperscript𝑋1𝐸subscriptsuperscript𝑋1𝐸𝑓𝑋P𝜔subscriptΩsubscript1superscript𝑋1𝐸𝜔𝑓𝑋𝜔P𝜔\displaystyle=\mathrm{Q}(X^{-1}(E))=\int_{X^{-1}(E)}f(X)\differential\mathrm{P% }(\omega)=\int_{\Omega}\mathbf{1}_{X^{-1}(E)}(\omega)f(X(\omega))\differential% \mathrm{P}(\omega)= roman_Q ( italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_E ) ) = ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_E ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_X ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P ( italic_ω ) = ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ω end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_E ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ω ) italic_f ( italic_X ( italic_ω ) ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P ( italic_ω )
=∫Ω𝟏E⁢(X⁢(ω))⁢f⁢(X⁢(ω))⁢dP⁢(ω)=∫Ψ𝟏E⁢(x)⁢f⁢(x)⁢dP#⁢X⁢(x)=∫Ef⁢(x)⁢dP#⁢X⁢(x).absentsubscriptΩsubscript1𝐸𝑋𝜔𝑓𝑋𝜔P𝜔subscriptΨsubscript1𝐸𝑥𝑓𝑥subscriptP#𝑋𝑥subscript𝐸𝑓𝑥subscriptP#𝑋𝑥\displaystyle=\int_{\Omega}\mathbf{1}_{E}(X(\omega))f(X(\omega))\differential% \mathrm{P}(\omega)=\int_{\Psi}\mathbf{1}_{E}(x)f(x)\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#% X}(x)=\int_{E}f(x)\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#X}(x).= ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ω end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_E end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X ( italic_ω ) ) italic_f ( italic_X ( italic_ω ) ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P ( italic_ω ) = ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_E end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) italic_f ( italic_x ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) = ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_E end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) .

In summary, we have that dQ#⁢XdP#⁢X=fsubscriptQ#𝑋subscriptP#𝑋𝑓\frac{\differential\mathrm{Q}_{\#X}}{\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#X}}=fdivide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = italic_f, with f:Ψ→[0,+∞):𝑓→Ψ0f\colon\Psi\to[0,+\infty)italic_f : roman_Ψ → [ 0 , + ∞ ).

Finally, then,

∫Ψlog⁡(dP#⁢XdQ#⁢X)⁢dP#⁢X=−∫Ψlog⁡(f)⁢dP#⁢X=−∫Ωlog⁡(f⁢(X))⁢dP=∫Ωlog⁡dPdQ⁢dP=𝔼P⁢[log⁡dPdQ].subscriptΨsubscriptP#𝑋subscriptQ#𝑋subscriptP#𝑋subscriptΨ𝑓subscriptP#𝑋subscriptΩ𝑓𝑋PsubscriptΩPQPsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]PQ\displaystyle\int_{\Psi}\log(\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#X}}{% \differential\mathrm{Q}_{\#X}})\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#X}=-\int_{\Psi}\log(% f)\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#X}=-\int_{\Omega}\log(f(X))\differential\mathrm{P% }=\int_{\Omega}\log\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}}{\differential\mathrm{Q}}% \differential\mathrm{P}=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\log\frac{\differential\mathrm% {P}}{\differential\mathrm{Q}}].∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ( start_ARG divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = - ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ψ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ( start_ARG italic_f end_ARG ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = - ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ω end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ( start_ARG italic_f ( italic_X ) end_ARG ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P = ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Ω end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q end_ARG ] . (33)

What discussed so far, allows to prove that ∫log⁡dP#⁢Y0≤s≤t,ϕdP#⁢Y0≤s≤t⁢dP#⁢ϕ⁢dP#⁢Y0≤s≤t,ϕ=𝔼P⁢[log⁡dP|ℛtdP|ℱtY⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ)]subscriptP#subscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡italic-ϕsubscriptP#subscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡subscriptP#italic-ϕsubscriptP#subscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡italic-ϕsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]evaluated-atPsubscriptℛ𝑡evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕ\int\log\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#Y_{0\leq s\leq t},\phi}}{% \differential\mathrm{P}_{\#Y_{0\leq s\leq t}}\differential\mathrm{P}_{\#\phi}}% \differential\mathrm{P}_{\#Y_{0\leq s\leq t},\phi}=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}% \left[\log\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}}}{\differential% \mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi% )}}\right]∫ roman_log divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_ϕ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT # italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ]. Indeed:

  • •

    Consider on the space (Ω,ℛt,P|ℛt)Ωsubscriptℛ𝑡evaluated-atPsubscriptℛ𝑡(\Omega,\mathcal{R}_{t},\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}})( roman_Ω , caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) the random variable T=(Y0≤s≤t,ϕ)𝑇subscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡italic-ϕT=(Y_{0\leq s\leq t},\phi)italic_T = ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ). By construction, σ⁢(T)=ℛt𝜎𝑇subscriptℛ𝑡\sigma(T)=\mathcal{R}_{t}italic_σ ( italic_T ) = caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

  • •

    Suppose that P|ℛtevaluated-atPsubscriptℛ𝑡\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}}roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is absolutely continuous w.r.t P|ℱtY×P|σ⁢(ϕ)evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕ\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\times\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT × roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (proved in the next subsection).

  • •

    Then the desired equality follows from Equation 33.

E.2 Part 2

Before proceeding, remember that the following holds: for all ℛt′⊆ℛtsubscriptsuperscriptℛ′𝑡subscriptℛ𝑡\mathcal{R}^{\prime}_{t}\subseteq\mathcal{R}_{t}caligraphic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⊆ caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, Qℛ|ℛt′=Qℛ′|ℛt′evaluated-atsuperscriptQℛsubscriptsuperscriptℛ′𝑡evaluated-atsuperscriptQsuperscriptℛ′subscriptsuperscriptℛ′𝑡{\mathrm{Q}^{\mathcal{R}}}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}^{\prime}_{t}}=\mathrm{Q}^{% \mathcal{R}^{\prime}}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}^{\prime}_{t}}roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

We restart from the r.h.s. of Equation 7. Thanks to the chain rule for Radon-Nykodim derivatives

=log⁡ψtℛ⁢(ψtℱY)−1⁢dQℛ|ℱtYdQℛ|ℱtY⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ)absentsubscriptsuperscript𝜓ℛ𝑡superscriptsubscriptsuperscript𝜓superscriptℱ𝑌𝑡1evaluated-atsuperscriptQℛsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡evaluated-atevaluated-atsuperscriptQℛsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕ\displaystyle=\log\psi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t}(\psi^{\mathcal{F}^{Y}}_{t})^{-1}\frac% {\differential{\mathrm{Q}^{\mathcal{R}}}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}}{% \differential{\mathrm{Q}^{\mathcal{R}}}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}% \differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}= roman_log italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG
=log⁡ψtℛ−log⁡ψtℱY+log⁡dQℛ|ℛtdQℛ|ℱtY⁢dQℛ|σ⁢(ϕ),absentsubscriptsuperscript𝜓ℛ𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜓superscriptℱ𝑌𝑡evaluated-atsuperscriptQℛsubscriptℛ𝑡evaluated-atevaluated-atsuperscriptQℛsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡superscriptQℛ𝜎italic-ϕ\displaystyle=\log\psi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t}-\log\psi^{\mathcal{F}^{Y}}_{t}+\log% \frac{\differential{\mathrm{Q}^{\mathcal{R}}}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}}}{% \differential{\mathrm{Q}^{\mathcal{R}}}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}% \differential{\mathrm{Q}^{\mathcal{R}}}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}},= roman_log italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_log divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ,

where we used Theorem 3 to make ψtℛsubscriptsuperscript𝜓ℛ𝑡\psi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t}italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ψtℱYsubscriptsuperscript𝜓superscriptℱ𝑌𝑡\psi^{\mathcal{F}^{Y}}_{t}italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT appear, and the fact that dQℛ|σ⁢(ϕ)=dP|σ⁢(ϕ)evaluated-atsuperscriptQℛ𝜎italic-ϕevaluated-atP𝜎italic-ϕ\differential{\mathrm{Q}^{\mathcal{R}}}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}=\differential% \mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Consequently

𝔼P⁢[log⁡dP|ℛtdP|ℱtY⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ)]=𝔼P⁢[log⁡ψtℛ−log⁡ψtℱY]+ℐ⁢(Y0;ϕ)subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]evaluated-atPsubscriptℛ𝑡evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]subscriptsuperscript𝜓ℛ𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝜓superscriptℱ𝑌𝑡ℐsubscript𝑌0italic-ϕ\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}\left[\log\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|% \,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}}}{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}% \differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\right]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}% \left[\log\psi^{\mathcal{R}}_{t}-\log\psi^{\mathcal{F}^{Y}}_{t}\right]+% \mathcal{I}(Y_{0};\phi)blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_ψ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] + caligraphic_I ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_ϕ )
=𝔼P⁢[∫0t𝔼P⁢[h⁢(Ys,X,s)|ℛs]⁢dWsℛ+12⁢∫0t‖𝔼P⁢[h⁢(Ys,X,s)|ℛs]‖2⁢ds]absentsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalℎsubscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscriptℛ𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝑊ℛ𝑠12superscriptsubscript0𝑡superscriptnormsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalℎsubscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscriptℛ𝑠2𝑠\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}\left[\int_{0}^{t}\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}% [h(Y_{s},X,s)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{s}]\differential W^{\mathcal{R}}_{s}+\frac{1}{2% }\int_{0}^{t}\norm{\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[h(Y_{s},X,s)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{s}]}^% {2}\differential s\right]= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_R end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s ]
−𝔼P⁢[∫0t𝔼P⁢[h⁢(Ys,X,s)|ℱsY]⁢dWsℱY+12⁢∫0t‖𝔼P⁢[h⁢(Ys,X,s)|ℱsY]‖2⁢ds]+ℐ⁢(Y0;ϕ)subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalℎsubscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝑊superscriptℱ𝑌𝑠12superscriptsubscript0𝑡superscriptnormsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalℎsubscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑠2𝑠ℐsubscript𝑌0italic-ϕ\displaystyle-\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}\left[\int_{0}^{t}\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}% [h(Y_{s},X,s)\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{s}]\differential W^{\mathcal{F}^{Y}}_{s}+% \frac{1}{2}\int_{0}^{t}\norm{\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[h(Y_{s},X,s)\,|\,\mathcal% {F}^{Y}_{s}]}^{2}\differential s\right]+\mathcal{I}(Y_{0};\phi)- blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s ] + caligraphic_I ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_ϕ )
=12⁢𝔼P⁢[∫0t‖𝔼P⁢[h⁢(Ys,X,s)|ℛs]‖2−‖𝔼P⁢[h⁢(Ys,X,s)|ℱsY]‖2⁢ds]+ℐ⁢(Y0;ϕ).absent12subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]superscriptsubscript0𝑡superscriptnormsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalℎsubscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscriptℛ𝑠2superscriptnormsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalℎsubscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑠2𝑠ℐsubscript𝑌0italic-ϕ\displaystyle=\frac{1}{2}\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}\left[\int_{0}^{t}\norm{% \mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[h(Y_{s},X,s)\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{s}]}^{2}-\norm{\mathbb{E% }_{\mathrm{P}}[h(Y_{s},X,s)\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{s}]}^{2}\differential s\right% ]+\mathcal{I}(Y_{0};\phi).= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ∥ start_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s ] + caligraphic_I ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_ϕ ) .

Actually, the result in the main is in a slightly different form. To show equivalence, it is necessary to prove that

=−𝔼P⁢[‖𝔼P⁢[h⁢(Ys,X,s)|ℱsY]‖2]absentsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]superscriptnormsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalℎsubscript𝑌𝑠𝑋𝑠subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑠2\displaystyle=-\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}\left[\norm{\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[h(Y_% {s},X,s)\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{s}]}^{2}\right]= - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∥ start_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_s ) | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]

which is trivially true since 𝔼P[⋅|ℱtY]=𝔼P[𝔼P[⋅|ℛs]|ℱtY]\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}\left[\cdot\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}\right]=\mathbb{E}_{% \mathrm{P}}\left[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}\left[\cdot\,|\,\mathcal{R}_{s}\right]% \,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ⋅ | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ⋅ | caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

Appendix F Proof of Theorem 6

F.1 Proof of Equation 9

The inequality is proven considering that: i)

ℐ⁢(Y0≤s≤t;ϕ)=𝔼P|ℱtY×P|σ⁢(ϕ)⁢[η⁢(dP|ℛtdP|ℱtY⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ))]ℐsubscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡italic-ϕsubscript𝔼evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕdelimited-[]𝜂evaluated-atPsubscriptℛ𝑡evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕ\mathcal{I}(Y_{0\leq s\leq t};\phi)=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{% Y}_{t}}\times\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\left[\eta\left(\frac{% \differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}}}{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{% \mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\right)\right]caligraphic_I ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_ϕ ) = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT × roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_η ( divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) ]

and

ℐ⁢(Y~t;ϕ)=𝔼P|σ⁢(Y~t)×P|σ⁢(ϕ)⁢[η⁢(dP|σ⁢(Y~t,ϕ)dP|σ⁢(Y~t)⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ))]=𝔼P|ℱtY×P|σ⁢(ϕ)⁢[η⁢(dP|σ⁢(Y~t,ϕ)dP|σ⁢(Y~t)⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ))],ℐsubscript~𝑌𝑡italic-ϕsubscript𝔼evaluated-atevaluated-atP𝜎subscript~𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕdelimited-[]𝜂evaluated-atP𝜎subscript~𝑌𝑡italic-ϕevaluated-atevaluated-atP𝜎subscript~𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕsubscript𝔼evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕdelimited-[]𝜂evaluated-atP𝜎subscript~𝑌𝑡italic-ϕevaluated-atevaluated-atP𝜎subscript~𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕ\mathcal{I}(\tilde{Y}_{t};\phi)=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\tilde{Y}_% {t})}\times\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\left[\eta\left(\frac{\differential% \mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\tilde{Y}_{t},\phi)}}{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{% \sigma(\tilde{Y}_{t})}\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\right)% \right]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\times\mathrm{P}\,|\,% _{\sigma(\phi)}}\left[\eta\left(\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(% \tilde{Y}_{t},\phi)}}{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\tilde{Y}_{t})}% \differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\right)\right],caligraphic_I ( over~ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; with η⁢(x)=x⁢log⁡x𝜂𝑥𝑥𝑥\eta(x)=x\log xitalic_η ( italic_x ) = italic_x roman_log italic_x, ii) that
