start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ) ] and iii) that Jensen’s inequality holds (η𝜂\etaitalic_η is convex on its domain)

𝔼P|ℱtY×P|σ⁢(ϕ)⁢[η⁢(dP|σ⁢(Y~t,ϕ)dP|σ⁢(Y~t)⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ))]subscript𝔼evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕdelimited-[]𝜂evaluated-atP𝜎subscript~𝑌𝑡italic-ϕevaluated-atevaluated-atP𝜎subscript~𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕ\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\times\mathrm{P}% \,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\left[\eta\left(\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{% \sigma(\tilde{Y}_{t},\phi)}}{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\tilde{Y}_{t% })}\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\right)\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT × roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_η ( divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( over~ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( over~ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) ]
=𝔼P|ℱtY×P|σ⁢(ϕ)⁢[η⁢(𝔼P|ℱtY×P|σ⁢(ϕ)⁢[dP|ℛtdP|ℱtY⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ)|σ⁢(Y~t,ϕ)])]absentsubscript𝔼evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕdelimited-[]𝜂subscript𝔼evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕdelimited-[]conditionalevaluated-atPsubscriptℛ𝑡evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕ𝜎subscript~𝑌𝑡italic-ϕ\displaystyle\qquad=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\times% \mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\left[\eta\left(\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{% \mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\times\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\left[\frac{% \differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}}}{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{% \mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\,|\,\sigma(% \tilde{Y}_{t},\phi)\right]\right)\right]= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT × roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_η ( blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT × roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG | italic_σ ( over~ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ) ] ) ]
≤𝔼P|ℱtY×P|σ⁢(ϕ)⁢[𝔼P|ℱtY×P|σ⁢(ϕ)⁢[η⁢(dP|ℛtdP|ℱtY⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ))|σ⁢(Y~t,ϕ)]]absentsubscript𝔼evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕdelimited-[]subscript𝔼evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕdelimited-[]conditional𝜂evaluated-atPsubscriptℛ𝑡evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕ𝜎subscript~𝑌𝑡italic-ϕ\displaystyle\qquad\quad\leq\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}% \times\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\left[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{% \mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\times\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\left[\eta\left(\frac% {\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}}}{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_% {\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\right)\,|\,% \sigma(\tilde{Y}_{t},\phi)\right]\right]≤ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT × roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT × roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_η ( divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) | italic_σ ( over~ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ) ] ]
=𝔼P|ℱtY×P|σ⁢(ϕ)⁢[η⁢(dP|ℛtdP|ℱtY⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ))].absentsubscript𝔼evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕdelimited-[]𝜂evaluated-atPsubscriptℛ𝑡evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕ\displaystyle\qquad=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\times% \mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\left[\eta\left(\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}\,% |\,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}}}{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}% \differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}\right)\right].= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT × roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_η ( divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) ] .

F.2 Proof of Conditional Independence and Mutual Information Equality

Formally the condition of conditional independence given π𝜋\piitalic_π is satisfied if for any a1,a2subscript𝑎1subscript𝑎2a_{1},a_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT positive random variables which are respectively σ⁢(X)𝜎𝑋\sigma(X)italic_σ ( italic_X ) and ℱtYsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT measurable, the following holds: 𝔼P⁢[a1⁢a2|σ⁢(πt)]=𝔼P⁢[a1|σ⁢(πt)]⁢𝔼P⁢[a2|σ⁢(πt)]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝑎1subscript𝑎2𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝑎1𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝑎2𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[a_{1}a_{2}\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}% }[a_{1}\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[a_{2}\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] (see for instance Van Putten & van Schuppen (1985)).

The sigma-algebra σ⁢(πt)𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡\sigma(\pi_{t})italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is by definition the smallest one that makes πtsubscript𝜋𝑡\pi_{t}italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT measurable. Since πtsubscript𝜋𝑡\pi_{t}italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is ℱtYsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT measurable, clearly σ⁢(πt)⊆ℱtY𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡\sigma(\pi_{t})\subseteq\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ⊆ caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. By the very definition of conditional expectation, 𝔼P⁢[a1|ℱtY]=⟨πt,a1⟩subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝑎1subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝑎1\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[a_{1}\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}]=\langle\pi_{t},a_{1}\rangleblackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟩, which is an σ⁢(πt)𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡\sigma(\pi_{t})italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) measurable quantity. Then 𝔼P[a1a2|σ(πt)]=𝔼P[𝔼P[a1a2|ℱtY]|σ(πt)]=𝔼P[𝔼P[a1|ℱtY]a2|σ(πt)]=𝔼P[𝔼P[⟨πt,a1⟩a2|σ(πt)]=⟨πt,a1⟩𝔼P[a2|σ(πt)]\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[a_{1}a_{2}\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}% }[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[a_{1}a_{2}\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}]\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{% t})]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[a_{1}\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}% _{t}]a_{2}\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}% }[\langle\pi_{t},a_{1}\rangle a_{2}\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]=\langle\pi_{t},a_{1}% \rangle\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[a_{2}\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟩ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟩ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]. Since ⟨πt,a1⟩=𝔼P⁢[⟨πt,a1⟩|σ⁢(πt)]=𝔼P⁢[𝔼P⁢[a1|ℱtY]|σ⁢(πt)]=𝔼P⁢[a1|σ⁢(πt)]subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝑎1subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝑎1𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝑎1subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditionalsubscript𝑎1𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡\langle\pi_{t},a_{1}\rangle=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\langle\pi_{t},a_{1}% \rangle\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[a% _{1}\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}]\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[a_{% 1}\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟩ = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ⟨ italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ⟩ | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ], the proof of conditional independence is concluded.

In summary, σ⁢(X)𝜎𝑋\sigma(X)italic_σ ( italic_X ) and ℱtYsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are conditionally independent given σ⁢(πt)𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡\sigma(\pi_{t})italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (⊂ℱtYabsentsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡\subset\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}⊂ caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT). This implies that P⁢(A|σ⁢(πt))=P⁢(A|ℱtY),∀A∈σ⁢(X)formulae-sequencePconditional𝐴𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡Pconditional𝐴subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡for-all𝐴𝜎𝑋\mathrm{P}(A\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t}))=\mathrm{P}(A\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}),\quad% \forall A\in\sigma(X)roman_P ( italic_A | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = roman_P ( italic_A | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , ∀ italic_A ∈ italic_σ ( italic_X ), or equivalently 𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)|σ⁢(πt)]=𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)|ℱtY]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐴𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐴subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(A)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm% {P}}[\mathbf{1}(A)\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. To prove this, it is sufficient to show that for any B∈ℱtY𝐵subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡B\in\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}italic_B ∈ caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, 𝔼P⁢[𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)|σ⁢(πt)]⁢𝟏⁢(B)]=𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)⁢𝟏⁢(B)]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐴𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡1𝐵subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]1𝐴1𝐵\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(A)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{% t})]\mathbf{1}(B)]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(A)\mathbf{1}(B)]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] bold_1 ( italic_B ) ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) bold_1 ( italic_B ) ]. By standard properties of conditional expectation 𝔼P⁢[𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)|σ⁢(πt)]⁢𝟏⁢(B)]=𝔼P⁢[𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)|σ⁢(πt)]⁢𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(B)|σ⁢(πt)]]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐴𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡1𝐵subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐴𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐵𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(A)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{% t})]\mathbf{1}(B)]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(% A)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(B)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t% })]]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] bold_1 ( italic_B ) ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_B ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] ]. Due to conditional independence 𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)|σ⁢(πt)]⁢𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(B)|σ⁢(πt)]=𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)⁢𝟏⁢(B)|σ⁢(πt)]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐴𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐵𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐴1𝐵𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(A)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{% P}}[\mathbf{1}(B)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(A)% \mathbf{1}(B)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_B ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) bold_1 ( italic_B ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]. Then, 𝔼P⁢[𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)|σ⁢(πt)]⁢𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(B)|σ⁢(πt)]]=𝔼P⁢[𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)⁢𝟏⁢(B)|σ⁢(πt)]]=𝔼P⁢[𝟏⁢(A)⁢𝟏⁢(B)]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐴𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐵𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional1𝐴1𝐵𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]1𝐴1𝐵\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(A)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{% t})]\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(B)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_{t})]]=\mathbb{E}_{% \mathrm{P}}[\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(A)\mathbf{1}(B)\,|\,\sigma(\pi_% {t})]]=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[\mathbf{1}(A)\mathbf{1}(B)]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_B ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) bold_1 ( italic_B ) | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] ] = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ bold_1 ( italic_A ) bold_1 ( italic_B ) ].

The mutual information equality is then proved considering that dP|ℛtdP|ℱtY⁢dP|σ⁢(ϕ)=dP⁢(ωx|ℱtY)dP⁢(ωx)evaluated-atPsubscriptℛ𝑡evaluated-atevaluated-atPsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡P𝜎italic-ϕPconditionalsuperscript𝜔𝑥subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡Psuperscript𝜔𝑥\frac{\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\mathcal{R}_{t}}}{\differential\mathrm{P}% \,|\,_{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}}\differential\mathrm{P}\,|\,_{\sigma(\phi)}}=\frac{% \differential\mathrm{P}(\omega^{x}\,|\,{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}})}{\differential% \mathrm{P}(\omega^{x})}divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_σ ( italic_ϕ ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P ( italic_ω start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_P ( italic_ω start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG, since the conditional probabilities exist, and that P⁢(ωx|ℱtY)=P⁢(ωx|σ⁢(πt))Pconditionalsuperscript𝜔𝑥subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡Pconditionalsuperscript𝜔𝑥𝜎subscript𝜋𝑡\mathrm{P}(\omega^{x}\,|\,{\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}})=\mathrm{P}(\omega^{x}\,|\,% \sigma(\pi_{t}))roman_P ( italic_ω start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_P ( italic_ω start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_σ ( italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ).

Appendix G A technical note

As anticipated in the main, 1 might be incompatible with the other technical assumptions in Appendix A. The problem might arise for singularities in the drift term at time t=T𝑡𝑇t=Titalic_t = italic_T, which are usually present in the construction of dynamics satisfying 1 like stochastic bridges. This mathematical subtlety can be more clearly interpreted by noticing that when 1 is satisfied the evolution of the posterior process πtsubscript𝜋𝑡\pi_{t}italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at time T𝑇Titalic_T can occupy a portion of the space of dimensionality lower than at any T−ϵ𝑇italic-ϵT-\epsilonitalic_T - italic_ϵ, ϵ>0italic-ϵ0\epsilon>0italic_ϵ > 0. Or, we can notice that if 1 is satisfied, ℐ⁢(Y0≤s≤T;V)=ℐ⁢(V;V)ℐsubscript𝑌0𝑠𝑇𝑉ℐ𝑉𝑉\mathcal{I}(Y_{0\leq s\leq T};V)=\mathcal{I}(V;V)caligraphic_I ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_V ) = caligraphic_I ( italic_V ; italic_V ) which can be equal to infinity depending on the actual structure of 𝒮𝒮\mathcal{S}caligraphic_S and the mapping V𝑉Vitalic_V. In many cases, a simple technical solution is to consider in the analysis only dynamics of the process in the time interval [0,T)0𝑇[0,T)[ 0 , italic_T )333This is akin to the discussion of arbitrage strategies in finance when the initial filtration is augmented with knowledge of the future value at certain time instants, and the fact that while the new process adapted w.r.t the new filtration is also a martingale w.r.t. a given new measure for all t∈[0,T)𝑡0𝑇t\in[0,T)italic_t ∈ [ 0 , italic_T ), it fails to do so for t=T𝑡𝑇t=Titalic_t = italic_T (thus giving an arbitrage opportunity)..In the reduced time interval [0,T)0𝑇[0,T)[ 0 , italic_T ), the technical assumptions are generally shown to be satisfied. For the practical purposes explored in this work this restriction makes no difference, and consequently neglect it for the rest of our discussion.

Appendix H Linear Diffusion Models

Consider the particular case of linear generative diffusion models Song et al. (2021), which are widely adopted in the literature and by practitioners. We consider the particular case of Equation 11, where the function F𝐹Fitalic_F has linear expression

Y^t=Y^0−α⁢∫0tY^s⁢ds+W^t,subscript^𝑌𝑡subscript^𝑌0𝛼superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript^𝑌𝑠𝑠subscript^𝑊𝑡\hat{Y}_{t}=\hat{Y}_{0}-\alpha\int\limits_{0}^{t}\hat{Y}_{s}\differential s+% \hat{W}_{t},over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_α ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s + over^ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (34)

for a given α≥0𝛼0\alpha\geq 0italic_α ≥ 0. We assume of course again that 1 holds, which implies that we should select Y^0=YT=Vsubscript^𝑌0subscript𝑌𝑇𝑉\hat{Y}_{0}=Y_{T}=Vover^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_V. Now, α𝛼\alphaitalic_α dictates the behavior of the \oldtextscsde, which can be cast to the so called Variance-Preserving and Variance Exploding schedules of diffusion models Song et al. (2021). In diffusion models jargon, Equation 34 is typically referred to as a noising process. Indeed, by analysing the evolution of Equation 34, Y^tsubscript^𝑌𝑡\hat{Y}_{t}over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT evolves to a noisier and noisier version of V𝑉Vitalic_V as t𝑡titalic_t grows. In particular, it holds that

Y^t=exp⁡(−α⁢t)⁢V+exp⁡(−α⁢t)⁢∫0texp⁡(α⁢s)⁢dW^s.subscript^𝑌𝑡𝛼𝑡𝑉𝛼𝑡superscriptsubscript0𝑡𝛼𝑠subscript^𝑊𝑠\hat{Y}_{t}=\exp(-\alpha t)V+\exp(-\alpha t)\int_{0}^{t}\exp(\alpha s)% \differential\hat{W}_{s}.over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_exp ( start_ARG - italic_α italic_t end_ARG ) italic_V + roman_exp ( start_ARG - italic_α italic_t end_ARG ) ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_exp ( start_ARG italic_α italic_s end_ARG ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP over^ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

The next result is a particular case of Theorem 7.

Lemma 1.

Consider the stochastic process Ytsubscript𝑌𝑡Y_{t}italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT which solves Equation 34. The same stochastic process also admits a ℱtYsubscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t}caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT–adapted representation

Yt=Y0+∫0tα⁢Ys+2⁢α⁢exp⁡(−α⁢(T−s))⁢𝔼P⁢[V|σ⁢(Ys)]−Ys1−exp⁡(−2⁢α⁢(T−s))⁢ds+Wt,subscript𝑌𝑡subscript𝑌0superscriptsubscript0𝑡𝛼subscript𝑌𝑠2𝛼𝛼𝑇𝑠subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional𝑉𝜎subscript𝑌𝑠subscript𝑌𝑠12𝛼𝑇𝑠𝑠subscript𝑊𝑡Y_{t}=Y_{0}+\int_{0}^{t}\alpha Y_{s}+2\alpha\frac{\exp(-\alpha(T-s))\mathbb{E}% _{\mathrm{P}}[V\,|\,\sigma(Y_{s})]-Y_{s}}{1-\exp(-2\alpha(T-s))}\differential s% +W_{t},italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 italic_α divide start_ARG roman_exp ( start_ARG - italic_α ( italic_T - italic_s ) end_ARG ) blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_V | italic_σ ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] - italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - roman_exp ( start_ARG - 2 italic_α ( italic_T - italic_s ) end_ARG ) end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s + italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (35)

where Y0=exp⁡(−α⁢T)⁢V+1−exp⁡(−2⁢α⁢T)2⁢α⁢ϵsubscript𝑌0𝛼𝑇𝑉12𝛼𝑇2𝛼italic-ϵY_{0}=\exp(-\alpha T)V+\sqrt{\frac{1-\exp(-2\alpha T)}{2\alpha}}\epsilonitalic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_exp ( start_ARG - italic_α italic_T end_ARG ) italic_V + square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 - roman_exp ( start_ARG - 2 italic_α italic_T end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_α end_ARG end_ARG italic_ϵ, with ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ a standard Gaussian random variable independent of V𝑉Vitalic_V and Wtsubscript𝑊𝑡W_{t}italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

As discussed in the main paper, we can now show that the same generative dynamics can be obtained under the \oldtextscnlf framework we present in this work, without the need to explicitly defining a backward and a forward process. In particular, we can directly select a observation function that corresponds to an Orstein-Uhlenbeck bridge (Mazzolo, 2017; Corlay, 2013), consequently satisfying 1, and obtain the generative dynamics of classical diffusion models. In particular we consider the following about H𝐻Hitalic_H444Notice that with H𝐻Hitalic_H selected as in 7 the validity of the theory considered is restricted to the time interval [0,T)0𝑇[0,T)[ 0 , italic_T ), see also Appendix G.:

Assumption 7.

The function H𝐻Hitalic_H in Equation 1 is selected to be of the linear form

H⁢(Yt,X,t)=mt⁢V−dlog⁡mtdt⁢Yt,𝐻subscript𝑌𝑡𝑋𝑡subscript𝑚𝑡𝑉subscript𝑚𝑡𝑡subscript𝑌𝑡H(Y_{t},X,t)=m_{t}V-\frac{\differential\log m_{t}}{\differential t}Y_{t},italic_H ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_X , italic_t ) = italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_log italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_t end_ARG italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (36)

with mt=αsinh⁡(α⁢(T−t))subscript𝑚𝑡𝛼𝛼𝑇𝑡m_{t}=\frac{\alpha}{\sinh{(\alpha(T-t))}}italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_α end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) ) end_ARG, where α≥0𝛼0\alpha\geq 0italic_α ≥ 0. When α=0𝛼0\alpha=0italic_α = 0, mt=dlog⁡mtdt=1T−tsubscript𝑚𝑡subscript𝑚𝑡𝑡1𝑇𝑡m_{t}=\frac{\differential\log m_{t}}{\differential t}=\frac{1}{T-t}italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_log italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_t end_ARG = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_T - italic_t end_ARG. Furthermore, Y0subscript𝑌0Y_{0}italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is selected as in Theorem 7. Under this assumption, YT=V,P−a.s.formulae-sequencesubscript𝑌𝑇𝑉P𝑎𝑠Y_{T}=V,\quad\mathrm{P}-a.s.italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_V , roman_P - italic_a . italic_s ., i.e. 1 is satisfied [Proof].

In summary, the particular case of Equation 1 (which is ℱY,Xsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑋\mathcal{F}^{Y,X}caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y , italic_X end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT adapted) under 7, can be transformed into a generative model leveraging Theorem 2, since 1 holds. When doing so, we obtain that the process Ytsubscript𝑌𝑡Y_{t}italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has ℱYsuperscriptℱ𝑌\mathcal{F}^{Y}caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT adapted representation equal to

Yt=Y0+∫0tms⁢𝔼P⁢(V|ℱsY)⁢ds−∫0tdlog⁡msds⁢Ys⁢ds+WtℱY,subscript𝑌𝑡subscript𝑌0superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝑚𝑠subscript𝔼Pconditional𝑉subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑠𝑠superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝑚𝑠𝑠subscript𝑌𝑠𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝑊superscriptℱ𝑌𝑡Y_{t}=Y_{0}+\int_{0}^{t}m_{s}\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}(V\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{s}% )\differential s-\int_{0}^{t}\frac{\differential\log m_{s}}{\differential s}Y_% {s}\differential s+{W}^{\mathcal{F}^{Y}}_{t},italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_V | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s - ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_log italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s end_ARG italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s + italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (37)

which is nothing but Equation 35 after some simple algebraic manipulation. The only relevant detail worth deeper exposition is the clarification about the actual computation of expectation of interest. If PP\mathrm{P}roman_P is selected such that Y^tsubscript^𝑌𝑡\hat{Y}_{t}over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT solves Equation 34, we have that

𝔼P⁢(V|ℱtY)=𝔼P⁢(YT|σ⁢(Y0≤s≤t))=𝔼P⁢(Y^0|σ⁢(Y^T−t≤s≤T))=𝔼P⁢(Y^0|σ⁢(Y^T−t))=𝔼P⁢(V|σ⁢(Yt)),subscript𝔼Pconditional𝑉subscriptsuperscriptℱ𝑌𝑡subscript𝔼Pconditionalsubscript𝑌𝑇𝜎subscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡subscript𝔼Pconditionalsubscript^𝑌0𝜎subscript^𝑌𝑇𝑡𝑠𝑇subscript𝔼Pconditionalsubscript^𝑌0𝜎subscript^𝑌𝑇𝑡subscript𝔼Pconditional𝑉𝜎subscript𝑌𝑡\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}(V\,|\,\mathcal{F}^{Y}_{t})=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}(Y_{% T}\,|\,\sigma(Y_{0\leq s\leq t}))=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}(\hat{Y}_{0}\,|\,% \sigma(\hat{Y}_{T-t\leq s\leq T}))=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}(\hat{Y}_{0}\,|\,% \sigma(\hat{Y}_{T-t}))=\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}(V\,|\,\sigma(Y_{t})),blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_V | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T - italic_t ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_σ ( over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T - italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) = blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_V | italic_σ ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) , (38)

where the second to last equality is due to the Markov nature of Y^tsubscript^𝑌𝑡\hat{Y}_{t}over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Moreover, in this particular case we can express the mutual information ℐ⁢(Y0≤s≤t;ϕ)=ℐ⁢(Yt;ϕ)ℐsubscript𝑌0𝑠𝑡italic-ϕℐsubscript𝑌𝑡italic-ϕ\mathcal{I}(Y_{0\leq s\leq t};\phi)=\mathcal{I}(Y_{t};\phi)caligraphic_I ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 ≤ italic_s ≤ italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_ϕ ) = caligraphic_I ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_ϕ ) ( where we removed the past of Y𝑌Yitalic_Y since the following Markov chain holds ϕ→Y^0→Y^t>0→italic-ϕsubscript^𝑌0→subscript^𝑌𝑡0\phi\rightarrow\hat{Y}_{0}\rightarrow\hat{Y}_{t>0}italic_ϕ → over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT → over^ start_ARG italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT) can be expressed in the simpler form

ℐ⁢(Yt;ϕ)=ℐ⁢(Y0;ϕ)+12⁢𝔼P⁢[∫0tms2⁢‖𝔼P⁢[V|σ⁢(Ys)]−𝔼P⁢[V|σ⁢(Ys,ϕ)]‖2⁢ds]ℐsubscript𝑌𝑡italic-ϕℐsubscript𝑌0italic-ϕ12subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscriptsuperscript𝑚2𝑠superscriptnormsubscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional𝑉𝜎subscript𝑌𝑠subscript𝔼Pdelimited-[]conditional𝑉𝜎subscript𝑌𝑠italic-ϕ2𝑠\mathcal{I}(Y_{t};\phi)=\mathcal{I}(Y_{0};\phi)+\frac{1}{2}\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm% {P}}\left[\int_{0}^{t}m^{2}_{s}\norm{\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[V\,|\,\sigma(Y_{s% })]-\mathbb{E}_{\mathrm{P}}[V\,|\,\sigma(Y_{s},\phi)]}^{2}\differential s\right]caligraphic_I ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_ϕ ) = caligraphic_I ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_ϕ ) + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_V | italic_σ ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_P end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_V | italic_σ ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_ϕ ) ] end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_s ] (39)

matching the result described in Franzese et al. (2023), obtained with the formalism of time reversal of \oldtextscsdes.

Appendix I Discussion about 7

This is easily checked thanks to the following equality

Yt=Y0⁢m0mt+V⁢m0mT−t+∫0tmsmt⁢dWs.subscript𝑌𝑡subscript𝑌0subscript𝑚0subscript𝑚𝑡𝑉subscript𝑚0subscript𝑚𝑇𝑡superscriptsubscript0𝑡subscript𝑚𝑠subscript𝑚𝑡subscript𝑊𝑠Y_{t}=Y_{0}\frac{m_{0}}{m_{t}}+V\frac{m_{0}}{m_{T-t}}+\int_{0}^{t}\frac{m_{s}}% {m_{t}}\differential W_{s}.italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + italic_V divide start_ARG italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T - italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (40)

To avoid cluttering the notation, we define ft=dlog⁡mtdtsubscript𝑓𝑡subscript𝑚𝑡𝑡f_{t}=\frac{\differential\log m_{t}}{\differential t}italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP roman_log italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_t end_ARG. To show that Equation 40 is true, it is sufficient to observe i) that initial conditions are met and ii) that the time differential of the process is the correct one. We proceed to show that indeed the second condition holds (the first one is trivially observed to be true).

dYt=−α⁢Y0⁢cosh⁡(α⁢(T−t))sinh⁡(α⁢T)+α⁢r⁢(X)⁢cosh⁡(α⁢t)sinh⁡(α⁢T)−α⁢cosh⁡(α⁢(T−t))⁢∫0t1sinh⁡(α⁢(T−s))⁢dWs+dWtsubscript𝑌𝑡𝛼subscript𝑌0𝛼𝑇𝑡𝛼𝑇𝛼𝑟𝑋𝛼𝑡𝛼𝑇𝛼𝛼𝑇𝑡superscriptsubscript0𝑡1𝛼𝑇𝑠subscript𝑊𝑠subscript𝑊𝑡\displaystyle\differential Y_{t}=-\alpha Y_{0}\frac{\cosh(\alpha(T-t))}{\sinh(% \alpha T)}+\alpha r(X)\frac{\cosh(\alpha t)}{\sinh(\alpha T)}-\alpha\cosh(% \alpha(T-t))\int_{0}^{t}\frac{1}{\sinh(\alpha(T-s))}\differential W_{s}+% \differential W_{t}start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = - italic_α italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG roman_cosh ( start_ARG italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α italic_T ) end_ARG + italic_α italic_r ( italic_X ) divide start_ARG roman_cosh ( start_ARG italic_α italic_t end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α italic_T ) end_ARG - italic_α roman_cosh ( start_ARG italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) end_ARG ) ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α ( italic_T - italic_s ) ) end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=−α⁢cosh⁡(α⁢(T−t))sinh⁡(α⁢(T−t))⁢(Y0⁢sinh⁡(α⁢(T−t))sinh⁡(α⁢T)+∫0tsinh⁡(α⁢(T−t))sinh⁡(α⁢(T−s))⁢dWs)+α⁢r⁢(X)⁢cosh⁡(α⁢t)sinh⁡(α⁢T)+dWtabsent𝛼𝛼𝑇𝑡𝛼𝑇𝑡subscript𝑌0𝛼𝑇𝑡𝛼𝑇superscriptsubscript0𝑡𝛼𝑇𝑡𝛼𝑇𝑠subscript𝑊𝑠𝛼𝑟𝑋𝛼𝑡𝛼𝑇subscript𝑊𝑡\displaystyle=-\alpha\frac{\cosh(\alpha(T-t))}{\sinh(\alpha(T-t))}\left(Y_{0}% \frac{\sinh(\alpha(T-t))}{\sinh(\alpha T)}+\int_{0}^{t}\frac{\sinh(\alpha(T-t)% )}{\sinh(\alpha(T-s))}\differential W_{s}\right)+\alpha r(X)\frac{\cosh(\alpha t% )}{\sinh(\alpha T)}+\differential W_{t}= - italic_α divide start_ARG roman_cosh ( start_ARG italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) ) end_ARG ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α italic_T ) end_ARG + ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α ( italic_T - italic_s ) ) end_ARG start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_α italic_r ( italic_X ) divide start_ARG roman_cosh ( start_ARG italic_α italic_t end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α italic_T ) end_ARG + start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=−α⁢coth⁡(α⁢(T−t))⁢(Yt−r⁢(X)⁢sinh⁡(α⁢t)sinh⁡(α⁢T))+α⁢r⁢(X)⁢cosh⁡(α⁢t)sinh⁡(α⁢T)+dWtabsent𝛼hyperbolic-cotangent𝛼𝑇𝑡subscript𝑌𝑡𝑟𝑋𝛼𝑡𝛼𝑇𝛼𝑟𝑋𝛼𝑡𝛼𝑇subscript𝑊𝑡\displaystyle=-\alpha\coth(\alpha(T-t))\left(Y_{t}-r(X)\frac{\sinh(\alpha t)}{% \sinh(\alpha T)}\right)+\alpha r(X)\frac{\cosh(\alpha t)}{\sinh(\alpha T)}+% \differential W_{t}= - italic_α roman_coth ( start_ARG italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) end_ARG ) ( italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_r ( italic_X ) divide start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α italic_t ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α italic_T ) end_ARG ) + italic_α italic_r ( italic_X ) divide start_ARG roman_cosh ( start_ARG italic_α italic_t end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α italic_T ) end_ARG + start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

=−ft⁢Yt+α⁢r⁢(X)⁢(coth⁡(α⁢(T−t))⁢sinh⁡(α⁢t)+cosh⁡(α⁢t)sinh⁡(α⁢T))+dWtabsentsubscript𝑓𝑡subscript𝑌𝑡𝛼𝑟𝑋hyperbolic-cotangent𝛼𝑇𝑡𝛼𝑡𝛼𝑡𝛼𝑇subscript𝑊𝑡\displaystyle=-f_{t}Y_{t}+\alpha r(X)\left(\frac{\coth(\alpha(T-t))\sinh(% \alpha t)+\cosh(\alpha t)}{\sinh(\alpha T)}\right)+\differential W_{t}= - italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_α italic_r ( italic_X ) ( divide start_ARG roman_coth ( start_ARG italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) end_ARG ) roman_sinh ( italic_α italic_t ) + roman_cosh ( start_ARG italic_α italic_t end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_sinh ( italic_α italic_T ) end_ARG ) + start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

=−ft⁢Yt+mt⁢r⁢(X)+dWtabsentsubscript𝑓𝑡subscript𝑌𝑡subscript𝑚𝑡𝑟𝑋subscript𝑊𝑡\displaystyle=-f_{t}Y_{t}+m_{t}r(X)+\differential W_{t}= - italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r ( italic_X ) + start_DIFFOP roman_d end_DIFFOP italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

where the result is obtained considering that

=eα⁢T+e−α⁢(T−2⁢t)−eα⁢(T−2⁢t)−e−α⁢Teα⁢(T−t)−e−α⁢(T−t)+(eα⁢t+e−α⁢t)eα⁢T−e−α⁢Tabsentsuperscript𝑒𝛼𝑇superscript𝑒𝛼𝑇2𝑡superscript𝑒𝛼𝑇2𝑡superscript𝑒𝛼𝑇superscript𝑒𝛼𝑇𝑡superscript𝑒𝛼𝑇𝑡superscript𝑒𝛼𝑡superscript𝑒𝛼𝑡superscript𝑒𝛼𝑇superscript𝑒𝛼𝑇\displaystyle\qquad=\frac{\frac{e^{\alpha T}+e^{-\alpha(T-2t)}-e^{\alpha(T-2t)% }-e^{-\alpha T}}{e^{\alpha(T-t)}-e^{-\alpha(T-t)}}+\left(e^{\alpha t}+e^{-% \alpha t}\right)}{e^{\alpha T}-e^{-\alpha T}}= divide start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α ( italic_T - 2 italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α ( italic_T - 2 italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + ( italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG

=2eα⁢(T−t)−e−α⁢(T−t).absent2superscript𝑒𝛼𝑇𝑡superscript𝑒𝛼𝑇𝑡\displaystyle\qquad=\frac{2}{e^{\alpha(T-t)}-e^{-\alpha(T-t)}}.= divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α ( italic_T - italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG .

Appendix J Experimental Details

J.1 Dataset details

The Shapes3D dataset (Kim & Mnih, 2018) includes the following attributes and the number of classes for each, as shown in Table 1.

J.2 Unconditional Diffusion Model Training

We train the unconditional denoising score network using the NCSN++ architecture (Song et al., 2021), which corresponds to a \oldtextscU-Net (Ronneberger et al., 2015). The model is trained from scratch using the score-matching objective. The training hyperparameters are summarized in Table 2.

J.3 Linear Probing Experiment Details

In the linear probing experiments, we train a linear classifier on the feature maps extracted from the denoising score network at various noise levels τ𝜏\tauitalic_τ. The training details are provided in Table 3.

J.4 Mutual Information Estimation Experiment Details

For mutual information estimation, we train a conditional diffusion model using the same NCSN++ architecture as before. The conditioning is incorporated by adding a distinct class embedding for each label present in the input image, added to the input embedding along with the timestep embedding. The hyperparameters are the same as those used for the unconditional diffusion model (see Table 2).

To calculate the mutual information, we use Equation 39, estimating the integral using the midpoint rule with 999 points uniformly spaced in [0,T]0𝑇[0,T][ 0 , italic_T ].

J.5 Forking Experiment Details

In the forking experiments, we use a ResNet50 (He et al., 2016) model with an additional linear layer, trained from scratch, to classify the generated images and assess label coherence across forks. The training details for the classifier are summarized in Table 4.

During the sampling process of the forking experiment, we use the settings summarized in Table 5.

J.6 Linear probing on raw data

In Figure 5, we evaluate the performance of linear probes trained on features maps extracted from the denoiser network, and show compare their log probability accuracy with a linear probe trained on the raw, noisy input and a random guesser. Throughout the generative process, linear probes obtain higher accuracy than the baselines: for large noise levels, a linear probe on raw input data fails, whereas the inner layers of the denoising network extract features that are sufficient to discern latent labels.

Generated on Fri Oct 4 12:36:32 2024 by LaTeXML
